contents: The major factions in the war were the Central Powers (Germany, Austria-Hungary, and Turkey) and the Allied Powers (France, Britain, Russia, Italy, Japan, and the United States). Over the course of five years, approximately 10 million military personnel and 7 million civilians (6) <u>were being</u> killed. There were 21 million wounded and 7.7 million missing or imprisoned by the end of the war.
